description: a(n) gives the number of different powers m^n for which the sum of the digits is equal to m.
comments: Number of m >= 1 with m = sum of digits of m^n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
crossrefs: Cf. A124359, A152147 (table of m such that the sum of digits of m^n equals m)
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Examples provided by _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 30 2006
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Andrew Plewe_, May 27 2007
